basics.name: Sudharshan Ravindran
basics.label: Software Engineer
basics.summary:
Conscientious, results-driven, articulate and analytical software engineer with several years’ exposure in data-driven software engineering teams; primarily focusing on backend and systems development of large-scale distributed systems. Strong in architectural research, software design and agile team management, having served as a tech lead at multiple companies.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Interested in challenging technical roles in scaling distributed web applications.

highlights: Involved in end-to-end development of a new product from the ground up, working in Node.js to build the React.js frontend and distributed Express.js RESTful API, with DynamoDB and Aurora RDS MySQL database systems.
Engineered the in-use worker environment to interface with various SOAP and RESTful logistics courier APIs.
Introduced continuous integration and code coverage tools with Travis and Codecov respectively, and created custom Docker containers to speed up testing execution.
Led an agile software development team of up to 8 engineers to maintain and extend the product as Tech Lead/Scrum Master.
Performed Product Manager duties and was responsible for development scheduling and product delivery.

Conducted literary research into potential psychophysical experiments in the area of human perception and developed the infrastructure using one of C++/Python/MATLAB and OpenGL 4.1, depending on the complexity and requirements of the task.
Built a general experiment engine in Python and OpenGL to create 3D vision experiments, with GUI interface for participant data collection.

Led an agile software development team of 4 engineers to meet milestone requirements extending the company’s real-time group-buying data collection infrastructure, handling an hourly volume of ~100,000 database entries.
Wrote a Microsoft Excel based data entry updater in Python for client and internal use to amend all chronological entries pertaining to group-buying deals in the relevant collections within MongoDB.
Supervised and reviewed developments to the data collection system and deployed updates nightly.
Extended the Scrapy data collection system, adding a templating tool for crawler generation, quickening development time and accommodating for outsourcing.
Maintained and extended the Django-based crawler monitoring, client dashboard and RESTful API infrastructure through Python and PostgreSQL.
Collaborated in designing innovative corporate web solutions for e-commerce enterprises in ASP.NET and JavaScript, and provided support for the company’s existing systems through the in-house CMS.

Developed a personnel database web application in PHP and MySQL from the ground up, to be used between the company and a local telecommunications operator to keep track of employees with company funded mobile phone services.
Participated in this community service initiative that allowed students to plan and execute our own service: Bring Moxi to the Society.
In the event, we prepared computers and helped kindergartners to create their very own Moxi drawings using a stylus.
These drawings were then printed onto customized e-cards which could be sent to parents and loved ones.
Took donated food to rural settlements.
Educated under-privileged children on the dangers of HIV/AIDS.
Schooled children suffering from Down Syndrome on alternate weekends.

publications.name: Campus Guiding System:Web:JavaScript, jQuery, PHP, MySQL
publications.summary: Campus Guiding System is a Google Maps-like application to provide directions within the HKUST campus. It calculates the shortest route between any two points in the university, using the Dijkstra's search algorithm. The system features a rich UI rendered in jQuery UI and jsDraw2D, providing map manipulation and location search functionalities. The backend is developed in PHP, utilizing MySQL as the database

publications.name: TweetIndex:Android:Java, Python, Django, MongoDB
publications.summary: TweetIndex is a microblogging analysis tool to identify stock market sentiments expressed through Twitter. Users of TweetIndex can follow influential twitter users who provide substantial advise on market behaviour. TweetIndex collects live tweets specific to the Standard & Poor's 100 Index stocks using Twitter's Streaming API and exposes this information via a Django-based, MongoDB backed RESTful API, an Android application provides the UI and makes user queries.

publications.name: Heatmap Generator:Windows:MATLAB, EyeLink
publications.summary: Heatmap Generator is a heatmap generation application developed in MATLAB for eye-tracking data from EyeLink. Data can be input in tab-separated values format (TSV) and will use images in either PNG or JPEG format to generate heatmaps in various conditions, see settings.m for a full set of options.

publications.name: load-directory:Library:Node.js
publications.summary: load-directory is an extension of the require-all module with require strategies for files, allowing for further customization and standardized structures during loading of directories in Node.js.

publications.name: suddi.github.io:Web:Node.js, React.js
publications.summary: suddi.github.io is a static single-page application developed using React.js in pure functional code. It extends the Ceevee template designed by Styleshout, ported over to React.js, and follows the JSON Resume schema to store a Curriculum Vitae in JSON format.

publications.name: eslint-config-suddi:Library:Node.js, Eslint
publications.summary: eslint-config-suddi is a custom eslint configuration module that provides backend and frontend eslint configurations for Node.js and React.js software development. It extends/combines the eslint-config-xo and eslint-plugin-react modules.

publications.name: zerohm:iOS:Objective-C
publications.summary: zerohm is an iPhone game designed to help science and engineering students learn the resistor color band codes, a fundamental identification system in the field of electronics. It features 3 modes aimed to take a student from A-Z in the understanding of resistor color codes. It was developed with Objective-C and XCode 3.1 for iPhone 3.1.

publications.name: dockerfiles:Library:Dockerfile
publications.summary: Dockerfiles for setting up Node.js workers making use of PDF generation libraries: zint.

publications.name: SimpleSudoku:Android:Java
publications.summary: A basic sudoku game for Android phones. Includes two levels of gameplay: "Level 1" pits the player in a partially filled grid, "Level 2" pits the player in an empty grid.

references.name: Joel Pitt:CTO:Demand Analytics Limited
references.reference: Sudharshan started working with Demand Analytics at the same time I joined the team. He quickly picked up Python despite not using it before, and is a reliable and conscientious developer. He confidently asks questions when specifications or plans are unclear, helping stimulate discussion when most crucial.

references.name: John Erik Metcalf:Founder:Demand Analytics Limited
references.reference: Sudharshan was one of our first hires at Demand Analytics and I'm glad we got him. He worked diligently and gave much of himself to the company. He's a sharp computer scientist with broad interests. He can be trusted with much responsibility and to adapt quickly.
